articles.title: Stock Market Today: Nasdaq Eyes Exit From Correction Territory, Bond Yields Fall - Barron's
articles.description: Stocks jumped in Asia after China cut its benchmark rate for mortgage lending for the first time in almost two years.
articles.content:
Stocks were rebounding Thursday as China slashed interest rates and U.S. bond yields were lower. 
Shortly after the open, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 134 points or 0.4%, after the index dr… [+222 chars]

articles.author: Qishin Tariq
articles.title: Historic Malaysian warship added to an MMO game - The Star Online
articles.description: Naval fans can now play with a decommissioned Royal Malaysian Navy warship, the KD Rahmat, which was added among other Pan Asian ships into a massively multiplayer online game.
articles.content:
One of Malaysias former Royal Malaysian Navy warships has been included as a playable unit in a naval warfare-themed multiplayer online game.
In a recent update, World Of Warships added Pan Asian Cr… [+1031 chars]

articles.title: Microsoft's Activision deal intensifies gaming war with Sony - Nikkei Asia
articles.description: Xbox maker's acquisition points to subscriptions overtaking consoles

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: New Omicron infections in Singapore more than double to 1185 - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): There were 1,185 new cases of those infected with the Covid-19 Omicron variant on Wednesday (Jan 19), more than double the 589 cases a day earlier, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

articles.title: Genting Hong Kong names liquidators as ‘Cruise to Nowhere’ operator winds up - South China Morning Post
articles.description: The liquidation is the biggest casualty in Asia’s tourism industry, as the Covid-19 pandemic, now in its third year, continues to wreak havoc on global travelling.
